DOC.detailed_description: This multicentric randomized phase III trial compare conventional radiotherapy concomitant chemotherapy ( arm A ) versus middle accelerate radiotherapy concomitant chemotherapy ( arm B ) versus accelerate radiotherapy alone ( arm C ) patient stage III-IV head neck squamous cell carcinoma ( HNSCC ) . The main end point event free survival . The treatment Bras A : Conventional radiotherapy give daily , deliver 70 Gy 7 week ( 5 fraction 2 Gy per week ) chemotherapy : 5FU : 600 mg/m²/d , Paraplatin : 70 mg/m²/d , D1-4 D22-25 D43-46 Bras B : middle accelerate radiotherapy deliver 70 Gy 6 week chemotherapy : 5FU : 600 mg/m²/d , Paraplatin : 70 mg/m²/d , D1-5 D29-33 - first part : radiotherapy give daily deliver 40 Gy 4 week 20 fraction 2 Gy - second part : radiotherapy give twice daily `` concomitant boost '' deliver 30 Gy 20 fraction 2 week ( 1,5 Gy x 2 / day ) Bras C : accelerated radiotherapy give twice daily deliver 64.8 Gy 3.5 week 36 fraction 1.8 Gy
